meanings: in the process of (development, construction, etc.)

lessons.japanese: ほとんどの発展途上国の都会の人口は非常に急激に増加している。
lessons.english: The urban population in most developing countries is increasing very fast.

lessons.japanese: たいていの発展途上国は過剰人口で苦しんでいる。
lessons.english: Most developing countries are suffering from overpopulation.

lessons.japanese: その小国は他の発展途上国に遅れまいと大変な努力をしている。
lessons.english: The small country is making great efforts to keep up with other developing countries.

lessons.japanese: その国は、民主国家への途上にある。
lessons.english: The country is on the way to becoming a democratic nation.

lessons.japanese: 米国の豊かさは発展途上国の貧しさと比較対照される。
lessons.english: The affluence of the United States is often contrasted with the poverty of undeveloped countries.

lessons.japanese: 彼の車は会社への途上で、故障した。
lessons.english: His car broke down on the way to work.

lessons.japanese: 発展途上国は財政問題で諸々の困難に苦しんでいる。
lessons.english: Developing countries suffer from difficulties of fiscal problems.

lessons.japanese: 発展途上国の人口増加は急速だ。
lessons.english: The growth in population is very rapid in developing countries.

lessons.japanese: 発展途上国では優れた技術者が不足している。
lessons.english: Good technicians are in short supply in the developing countries.

lessons.japanese: 日本は開発途上国に対し、２０億円の包括援助を保証しました。
lessons.english: Japan guaranteed a 2 billion yen aid package to developing countries.

lessons.japanese: 途上国では優れた技術者が不足してる。
lessons.english: Good technicians are in short supply in the developing countries.

lessons.japanese: 大統領は発展途上諸国に十分な援助を提供することを決めた。
lessons.english: The President decided to provide developing countries with sufficient aid.

lessons.japanese: 先進国は発展途上国を援助しなければならない。
lessons.english: Advanced countries must give aid to developing countries.
